alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Northumberland, Richmond, southeastern Westmoreland and southeastern Essex Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 546 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dunnsville, or near Tappahannock, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tappahannock, Warsaw, Callao, Center Cross, Kinsale, Coles Point, Dunnsville, Hague, Lewisetta, Sharps, Heathsville, Farnham, Haynesville, Westmoreland, Lottsburg, Threeway, Upright, Mount Holly, Tidewater and Lyells. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland
